channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The alley way is absolutely full of fallen leaves and is incredibly slippy with so many extra pedestrians having to use it. It is also uneven in places making it difficult to navigate., 14th November
item.description:
The entire alley needs to be swept, between London Road and Hartlebury Way (Glenfall Way)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Courtfield Drive, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is no street lighting, 14th November
item.description:
There is no street lighting at the end of the alleyway from Laxton Road to Green Lane making it pitch black, impossible to walk through the gate safely particularly with wet leaves making it slippy under foot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The lane control approach sign is getting obscured again, 13th November
item.description:
The lane control approach sign from Churchdown towards Elmbridge Court Roundabout (A40 / A417) is getting obscured again by vegetation. Southbound, from Churchdown. Could the greenery be trimmed back again please ? TIA ! [NOTE : I've recently raised this via this app under 'vegetation', but I think it went to Glos City Council / Ubico, who said it was not their jurisdiction, and closed the request]
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is missing (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Dangerous deep pothole, 13th November
item.description:
On the side with the pub but further towards gchq end of the road. I was cycling and had to swerve to avoid it, could easily have come off my bike.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Whittington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ridiculous road closure that has no purpose, 13th November
item.description:
Please remove the road closed - residents access only signs that appear in our road every time there are races at the racecourse. They were put in place on Tuesday for races that I assume start tomorrow. It serves no purpose - those who want free parking simply ignore it and come into the street and the traffic wardens cannot ticket them for doing so. We have several delivery drivers who haven’t delivered claiming they couldn’t access the street as it was unsafe to do so. This has cost us money as we had tradesmen waiting for urgent next day deliveries that didn’t come. I’ve asked repeatedly last year and this “what is the purpose of these signs” and received no response. Please come asap and remove them - they are nonsensical, ugly and have no purpose whatsoever. They are now causing delivery issues too.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Kensington Avenue, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road gulley along east side of old bath road full of leaf and other washed down litter stopping drains from operating, 13th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Old Bath Road, Fairview, Cheltenham

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Whittington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: I deep and sharp and wide divot across the whole length of the road, also one further up towards the corner round onto chosen way, 13th November
item.description:
On colwell avenue just after the Wilkes avenue right hand turning, needs filling in and it’s a brutal divot and one exactly the same further up, makes a proper thud in the car and is unavoidable

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Colwell Avenue, Hucclecote, Gloucester

item.title: Horrific road surface coming off churchdown lane into hucclecote, 13th November
item.description:
Coming off down the hill under the bridge into hucclecote on churchdown lane, before the speed bump before hucclecote rugby club turning. I know it’s been recently re surfaced in the past year but it’s absolutely abysmal and needs to be smooth, it’s ridiculously deep and bumpy, people still going on the other side of the road to avoid
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchdown Lane, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light at junction of Winchcombe Street and Fairview road is faulty, 13th November
item.description:
The traffic light at the junction of Winchcombe Street and Fairview Road does not detect solo motorcycles and remains on red until a larger vehicle comes along to trigger it. When there is no traffic you have no choice other than to treat it as an uncontrolled junction, which is still technically an offence. This issue has been reported previously.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Fairview Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Abandoned roadworks sign, 13th November
item.description:
Christ Church Road, outside Christchurch Court (GL50 2PZ). Sign has been kicking around for months - was originally tied to a large cone on the road verge. Cone disappeared weeks ago but sign still on pavement. Left behind by third party contractor, possibly. It's now street junk and needs to be removed as whoever left it behind isn't coming back for it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Christchurch Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Diverted traffic signs, 13th November
item.description:
Multiple "diverted traffic" signs - not clear what road closure / diversion they relate to? Queens Road - adjacent to traffic lights at Christ Church Road crossroads. A40 Lansdown Road - adjacent to traffic lights at Christ Church Road / Talbot Road crossroads. A40 Lansdown Road - outside Dean Close school A40 Westal Green (Texaco) roundabout - multiple. If for a current (live) diversion then fair enough, but if they were for a past diversion route which is no longer active then why are the signs still here (all been around for months)?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Please resurface Harp Hill, 13th November
item.description:
There are multiple potholes which have opened up again after wet weather despite your patching efforts. Please pay Harp Hill the attention it deserves, close it and resurface this entire section properly before there is an accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harp Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 13th November
item.description:
